result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Hearing on June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits signed and filed.  Exhibits shall be disposed of pursuant to the signed Stipulation and Order and based on the retention period for exhibits in SCR 72.01(46).  Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.

10:46 AM Defendant Gerald L Boll in court with attorney Andrew Mishlove.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Town of Oconomowoc Police Department Officer Spencer Kranz sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Brejcha.  Exhibit #1 marked, offered and received into evidence.  Cross examination by Attorney Mishlove.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney objects to bind over without argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  Attorney Mishlove stands mute on a plea and would ask for the Court to enter a plea on behalf of the defendant with the understanding he knows who the case is assigned to.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing. The Defendant is to report to WCS by end of business on Tuesday, March 29, 2022.

02:31 PM Defendant Gerald L Boll in court, in custody, with attorney Andrew Mishlove.   Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
The Court notes that there is nothing in the 4 corners of the criminal complaint that states a passenger in the vehicle was under the age of 16 and so strikes that paragraph from the charging language. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if a WCS non compliance letter is filed, the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.
filed by Attorney Andrew Mishlove
